verses.verse: A prayer <S%H8605><s%> of Habakkuk, <S%H2265><s%> the prophet, <S%H5030><s%> set to victorious music. <S%H7692><s%>

Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> I have heard <S%H8085><s%> of your fame. <S%H8088><s%> I stand in awe of your deeds, <S%H6467><s%> Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> Renew your work <S%H6467><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the years. <S%H8141><s%> In the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the years <S%H8141><s%> make it known. <S%H3045><s%> In wrath, <S%H7267><s%> you remember <S%H2142><s%> mercy. <S%H7355><s%>

God <S%H433><s%> came <S%H935><s%> from Teman, <S%H8487><s%> the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> from Mount <S%H2022><s%> Paran. <S%H6290><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%> His glory <S%H1935><s%> covered <S%H3680><s%> the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> and his praise <S%H8416><s%> filled <S%H4390><s%> the earth. <S%H776><s%>
His splendor <S%H5051><s%> is like the sunrise. <S%H216><s%> Rays <S%H7161><s%> shine <S%H216><s%> from his hand, <S%H3027><s%> where his power <S%H5797><s%> is hidden. <S%H2253><s%>
Plague <S%H1698><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him, <S%H7565><s%> and pestilence followed <S%H3318><s%> his feet. <S%H7272><s%>

He stood, <S%H5975><s%> and shook <S%H4128><s%> the earth. <S%H776><s%> He looked, <S%H7200><s%> and made the nations <S%H1471><s%> tremble. <S%H5425><s%> The ancient <S%H5703><s%> mountains <S%H2042><s%> were crumbled. <S%H6327><s%> The age-old <S%H5769><s%> hills <S%H1389><s%> collapsed. <S%H7817><s%> His ways <S%H1979><s%> are eternal. <S%H5769><s%>
I saw <S%H7200><s%> the tents <S%H168><s%> of Cushan <S%H3572><s%> in affliction. <S%H205><s%> The dwellings <S%H3407><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> trembled. <S%H7264><s%>

Was Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> displeased <S%H2734><s%> with the rivers? <S%H5104><s%> Was your anger <S%H639><s%> against the rivers, <S%H5104><s%> or your wrath <S%H5678><s%> against the sea, <S%H3220><s%> that you rode <S%H7392><s%> on your horses, <S%H5483><s%> on your chariots <S%H4818><s%> of salvation? <S%H3444><s%>

You <S%H6181><s%> uncovered <S%H5783><s%> your bow. <S%H7198><s%> You called for your <S%H4294><s%> sworn <S%H7621><s%> arrows. <S%H562><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%> You split <S%H1234><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> with rivers. <S%H5104><s%>

The mountains <S%H2022><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> you, <S%H2342><s%> and were afraid. The storm <S%H2230><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> passed by. <S%H5674><s%> The deep <S%H8415><s%> roared <S%H5414><s%> <S%H6963><s%> and lifted up <S%H5375><s%> its hands <S%H3027><s%> on high. <S%H7315><s%>

The sun <S%H8121><s%> and moon <S%H3394><s%> stood still <S%H5975><s%> in the sky, <S%H2073><s%> at the light <S%H216><s%> of your arrows <S%H2671><s%> as they went, <S%H1980><s%> at the shining <S%H5051><s%> of your glittering <S%H1300><s%> spear. <S%H2595><s%>
You marched through <S%H6805><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> in wrath. <S%H2195><s%> You threshed <S%H1758><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> in anger. <S%H639><s%>

You went forth <S%H3318><s%> for the salvation <S%H3468><s%> of your people, <S%H5971><s%> for the salvation <S%H3468><s%> of your anointed. <S%H4899><s%> You crushed <S%H4272><s%> the head <S%H7218><s%> of the land <S%H1004><s%> of wickedness. <S%H7563><s%> You stripped <S%H6168><s%> them head <S%H6677><s%> to foot. <S%H3247><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

You pierced <S%H5344><s%> the heads <S%H7218><s%> of his warriors <S%H6518><s%> with their own spears. <S%H4294><s%> They came as a whirlwind <S%H5590><s%> to scatter <S%H6327><s%> me, <S%H5951><s%> gloating as if to devour <S%H398><s%> the wretched <S%H6041><s%> in secret. <S%H4565><s%>
You trampled <S%H1869><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> with your horses, <S%H5483><s%> churning <S%H2563><s%> mighty <S%H7227><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%>

I heard, <S%H8085><s%> and my body <S%H990><s%> trembled. <S%H7264><s%> My lips <S%H8193><s%> quivered <S%H6750><s%> at the voice. <S%H6963><s%> Rottenness <S%H7538><s%> enters <S%H935><s%> into my bones, <S%H6106><s%> and I tremble <S%H7264><s%> in my place, <S%H5117><s%> because I must wait quietly for the day <S%H3117><s%> of trouble, <S%H6869><s%> for the coming up <S%H5927><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> who invade us. <S%H1464><s%>

For though the fig tree <S%H8384><s%> doesn't <S%H6524><s%> flourish, nor fruit <S%H2981><s%> be in the vines; <S%H1612><s%> the labor <S%H4639><s%> of the olive <S%H2132><s%> fails, <S%H3584><s%> the fields <S%H7709><s%> yield <S%H6213><s%> no food; <S%H400><s%> the flocks <S%H6629><s%> are cut off <S%H1504><s%> from the fold, <S%H4356><s%> and there is no herd <S%H1241><s%> in the stalls: <S%H7517><s%>
yet I will rejoice <S%H5937><s%> in Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> I will be joyful <S%H1523><s%> in the God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation! <S%H3468><s%>

Yahweh, <S%H3069><s%> the Lord, <S%H136><s%> is my strength. <S%H2428><s%> He makes <S%H7760><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> like deer <S%H355><s%>'s feet, <S%H1869><s%> and enables me to go in high places. <S%H1116><s%> For the music director, <S%H5329><s%> on my stringed instruments. <S%H5058><s%>
